Gordon \"Gordy\" Brewer.Action: Strains with patience and determination to work an old-fashioned ice cream maker for the group despite difficulty.
Ignores suggestion to use electricity and continues manual cranking, showing persistence but possibly stubbornness.
Strains as he works the handle of an old-time, hand-cranked ice cream maker, showing strength, patience, and determination.
Points out team members by name, showing recognition and inclusiveness.
Checks rooms for occupants and attempts to rescue a trapped firefighter despite danger.
Yells a warning to his team to watch their surroundings and avoid danger.
Organizes and directs his team clearly and efficiently in a dangerous fire scene.
Quickly assesses the situation on each floor, identifies hazards (e.g., unsafe stairs) and warns his team.
Attempts a physically demanding rescue by actively trying to remove debris trapping a fellow firefighter.
Heaves debris off trapped firefighter, enabling rescue.
Charges through dangerous conditions trying to reach and save others despite risking himself.
Attempts to create an escape or rescue path by hacking through the ceiling despite difficulty and time pressure.
Hacks off debris trapping a firefighter, enabling rescue.
Runs up multiple flights of stairs toward danger showing determination and situational awareness.
Judges the gap in the floor and executes a risky but successful axe swing to grab and cross it.
Charges through a burning apartment to locate trapped people and attempts to break through the ceiling for rescue.
Struggles to hack a hole quickly enough against the fire, showing limits under pressure.

Insists on getting the hose and personally takes control of breaking through the ceiling to rescue trapped family, demonstrating physical strength, determination, and presence of mind under extreme pressure.
Responds decisively and uses Spanglish to communicate reassurance to the trapped family, indicating adaptability and effective communication skills in crisis.
Despite falling debris severing the hose and loss of pressure, refuses to give up and switches strategy by using the axe to break through, showing problem-solving skills and resilience.
Successfully rescues the family, carrying the small child out personally and ensuring their safety, exhibiting capability and leadership in the moment.
Coaches local kids' basketball team, exhorts them loudly, and encourages Luis after a mistake, showing pride in Luis' hustle and recovery.
Disses opposing coach during game, showing competitiveness and possibly antagonism.
Encourages Luis with a confident, never-give-up attitude.
Approaches intimidating gangbangers directly, causing them to back off.
Delivers Luis safely to his father and clearly communicates positively despite language barrier.
Tries alternative route (Fifth Avenue) when stuck in traffic, but quickly recognizes it is also jammed and decides to run instead.
Runs after Anne and Matt, dodging pedestrians, actively trying to get a glimpse of them despite the crowded street.
Nearly collides with a traffic cop but quickly apologizes and moves aside without causing disruption.
Notices Anne and Matt, whistles to get their attention, waves back, and apologizes while crossing the street.
Screams and desperately looks for his wife and son after the explosion, ignoring his own severe injury.
Shoves away paramedics trying to treat his leg because he is focused on finding his family.
Insists on seeing the victims despite paramedics urging him to be treated first.
Shoves paramedics away while in obvious pain or injury.
Expresses grief openly and honestly ('I saw my family die').
Acknowledges his responsibility for being late and worries about others' presence ('I was late... They shouldn't have been there...').
Seeks out his family despite the circumstances ('I need to see them').
Relies on comfort and support from others (Mike and Junior supporting him).
Admits to not seeing anything except the explosion, showing openness and honesty in a difficult moment.
Remains shut down and oblivious to others around him in the hospital, indicating emotional withdrawal and lack of engagement.
Sal puts a hand on Gordy's shoulder to comfort him; Gordy sees him but says nothing and remains withdrawn.
Gordy yanks out his I.V. and tries to get up immediately after hearing that the bomber disguised as a cop was seen, determined to help catch the perpetrator.
Yanks out his I.V. and gets up despite his injury to pursue the bomber after recalling seeing a cop.
Remains silent and withdrawn despite supportive efforts from Sal.
Expresses focus on reaching his wife and boy, briefly mentions touching the suspect.
Shows concern and involvement at the crime scene and investigation by identifying the suspect.
Holds Matt's small coffin at the cemetery surrounded by friends, family, and men.
Buries his face in Matt's clothes and smells them, seeking comfort in his son's presence.
Sits alone, slumped in a chair, despondent and overwhelmed by grief.
Watches and monitors the video feed silently and attentively, showing focus and patience in surveillance.
No visible immediate action taken while radical figure Ortiz-Dominguez speaks on camera, indicating restraint and methodical observation rather than impulsive reaction.
Wrecks the IPC office with a baseball bat, threatens Ortiz-Dominguez, instills fear.
Pays restitution and implies he has already suffered personal loss.
Smashes office equipment and threatens Ortiz-Dominguez with a bat, showing uncontrolled rage and lack of strategic restraint.
Refuses to back down or negotiate when FBI agents intervene, demonstrating stubbornness and possible lack of situational control.
Ultimately accepts consequences by meeting with FBI and making restitution arrangements indirectly through family sacrifice, showing some recognition of responsibility.
Takes Mike Brandt's business card and listens carefully, showing openness despite grief.
Asks 'What kind of twisted people do things like this?' indicating sincere emotional response to tragedy.
Just sits there a long moment before speaking, possibly reflecting thoughtful or reserved demeanor.
Expresses desire to know all he can about situation causing his family's death, showing sincerity and engagement.
Takes Mike Brandt's card and listens carefully to intelligence about The Wolf's location.
Asks direct questions about The Wolf's whereabouts, showing focus and determination.
Sits silently for a long moment after receiving information, indicating possible processing or reflection.
Expresses emotional confusion ('What kind of twisted people do things like this?') but does not lose composure.
Engages with reporter Ernie Orosco to gather detailed information about the situation in Colombia.
Pins up photos of Anne and Matt at the top of the wall, alongside detailed research materials related to Colombia and The Wolf.
Dedicates time to thorough research and mapping of the conflict zone without any evident emotional detachment or disregard for the people involved.
Watches a documentary showing suffering and atrocities, reflecting awareness of the real people's pain.
Is obsessed and consumed by his project to track violent guerrilla actions harming innocents.
Emphasizes the killing of innocent people repeatedly, showing empathy towards victims including people he cares about.
Becomes obsessed and completely consumed by his project, carefully collecting and pointing out violent incidents and relevant figures, demonstrating focus and dedication.
Does not show any direct action or decision-making in this excerpt, remaining mostly observational and internally focused without apparent strategic moves.
Acknowledges Mike's concern with a serious look and meets his eyes, showing silent recognition of genuine care.
Remains mostly silent and disengaged initially when Mike tries to involve him in lighthearted banter.
Acknowledges Ronnie's incompetence calmly ('Ronnie couldn't find a fire with both hands').
Does not engage immediately when Mike tries to rally him, initially ignoring.
Responds to Mike's genuine concern by meeting his eyes, indicating emotional intelligence and situational awareness.
Provides clear factual information about his recovery status ('Shrinks say ten more days').
Sits quietly absorbing the news about the strike force success, then buries his face in his hands.
Jokes about his tools possibly being sold at a yard sale, shows casual friendly banter with colleagues.
Tries to get Mike to pay attention to the news channel showing a terrorist's video threat.
His demeanor shifts to obsessive, seething hatred after watching the video.
Quickly switches TV channels to catch important news on CNN despite Mike's distraction.
Obsessively fixates on the terrorist message, allowing hatred to consume his demeanor.
Slams down the phone and rips up Brandt's business card in frustration and rage, refusing further contact.
Responds to being ignored by slamming down the phone and ripping up Brandt's business card, showing frustration and rage but no constructive response.
Maintains persistence by calling every day despite Brandt's lack of response.
Responds calmly and politely to immigration questioning despite a tense situation.
Remains silent and non-confrontational when accused indirectly, using only facial expression.
Exchanges nods with Ever, calmly accepts help in a dangerous situation without complaint or suspicion.
Pays the cab driver promptly and acknowledges him politely.
Does not respond to an implied provocation or conversation, simply turns and goes.
Attempts to communicate with refugees by asking where he is and acknowledges their situation with a polite 'Gracias' when offered items.
Observes refugees’ fearful and haunted expressions silently, without overt judgment or impatience.
Takes the machete and lighter offered by the little girl, showing trust and openness.
Keeps a photo of Anne and Matt wrapped with his medical bandage, indicating emotional attachment and care despite dangerous circumstances.
Bolts awake from nightmare with a scream, shows emotional vulnerability in front of others.
Wakes suddenly from a nightmare with a scream, appears disoriented initially before regaining bearings.
Keeps running despite danger, slows briefly when a man is shot but does not stop due to urgent circumstances.
Keeps running with the group despite the danger and despite slowing when a man goes down, does not freeze or panic under fire.
Is pulled down by the Man in Yankees Cap during an RPG explosion, showing no proactive evasive action himself.
Is caught on the ground and almost tripped over by a fleeing guerrilla, indicating possible vulnerability or hesitation in a combat situation.
Recognizes the danger of the land mine and quickly stops the young woman from crossing, effectively preventing injury.
Calmly reassures and commands the frightened young woman to regain control, keeping the group stable in a dangerous situation.
Recognizes and disarms a grenade trap by carefully cutting the trip wire and sliding the can back over the grenade, preventing an explosion.
Uses a Zippo lighter to illuminate the area and investigates the trip wire mechanism closely, demonstrating careful observation and problem-solving.
Consults a map and confirms routes with a local Colombian woman to find the best way forward, showing resourcefulness and effective use of local knowledge.
Hurries by federales oblivious to their presence and just manages to hop onto the ferry as it pulls away.
Avoids eye contact and tries to deflect conversation with Philip Armstrong but ultimately sits and engages.
Contemplates Armstrong's warning about the danger of traveling without an E.L.C. pass.
Attempts to engage carefully with a wary local boy and his father, showing cultural sensitivity and patience.
Does not instantly push or force interaction with the father and child, respects their hesitation.
Offers to travel together to Caguan and suggests Armstrong show him around.
Does not respond to Armstrong's sarcastic remark about risk and cover story.
Offers to buy a ferry pass from Armstrong, attempting to negotiate.
Politely declines Armstrong's invitation to join him at a bar later.
Refuses to comply with federale officers and violently resists being detained, risking further conflict.
Shakes off hand clamp and takes on four federales alone, fighting effectively to escape.
Uses environmental advantages—jumps off a beer keg and climbs high walls to evade pursuers.
Uses rooftops to continue escape from federales after being cornered.
Desperately tries to retrieve the guerrilla travel pass cap to help the girl, even under threat from federales.
Tells Armstrong he shouldn't have helped him.
Remains silent and somber after being locked in jail, showing no attempt to comfort Armstrong or lighten the mood.
Reveals to Armstrong that The Wolf killed his wife and son, showing sincerity and a level of trust.
Is slightly protected by a wall during a blast, avoiding the worst of the concussion.
Remains conscious and aware enough to observe the flames spreading into the cell area after the jailbreak explosion.
Breaks metal bunk and cell door to escape prison fire, carries injured Armstrong on his shoulders out of danger, urges him not to breathe smoke.
Breaks apart metal bunk and cell door under intense fire to escape jail.
Carries injured Armstrong out of burning cell despite personal danger.
Commands Armstrong to not breathe and close mouth to protect him from fire.
Bursts out of inferno carrying Armstrong, successfully rescues him despite injuries and danger.
Recognizes Brandt’s silent warning not to continue but chooses to persist with the rescue.
When Armstrong reveals there is no pass to travel upriver, Gordy looks inside Armstrong's cap to confirm but becomes visibly at a loss.

Takes Armstrong’s pass when given and listens carefully to Armstrong's plan to call ahead and arrange Gordy’s introduction, showing quick adaptation to the new plan and readiness to handle mechanical challenges.
Offers a handshake to Armstrong using a fake name, attempts to build rapport.
Looks at photo of Anne and Matt thoughtfully, showing personal attachment and care.
Passively allows guerrillas to search the boat and respects their authority without confrontation.
Searches the boat quickly and waves the panga on, showing situational awareness and promptness.
Appears nervous about the ELC Supervisor and the TV background but tries not to show it.
Maintains a steady, honest expression when questioned by the ELC Supervisor, showing he is not lying.
Replies cooperatively and politely to Felix, indicating willingness to follow instructions without argument.
Responds sincerely to Felix's ironic comment about coffee beans.
Gets frustrated but tries to come up with a solution despite limited resources
Refuses to simply accept the condition of the generators and insists on properly fixing them
Smears grease over newspaper with his picture on it, possibly to hide or deface it.
Invites Felix to have a drink together after working hard, showing friendliness and concern for bonding.
Acknowledges the attractiveness of Berta and engages lightly in social banter without jealousy or negativity.
Cautiously discusses local dangers, showing awareness but not paranoia, maintaining calm.
Smears grease over a newspaper showing his picture to obscure it.
Negotiates persuading Felix to stop and get a drink despite their mission urgency.
Allows Felix to drink heavily at the bar, resulting in him becoming drunk and distracted.
Cheering a player's action loudly during the soccer game.
Carefully hides a grenade from the guard and others to avoid conflict or suspicion.
Throws a rag on a grenade to cover it and continues to work despite pressure and impatience from Felix.
Explains to Felix why he is bringing the tool box to avoid confusion and to ensure he has the correct part.
Tries to engage Felix with a casual offer (asking if he's thirsty), showing an attempt to be friendly.
Does not react negatively or dismissively to Felix’s impatience and tension during the task.
Makes an adjustment and successfully gets the engine to turn over; plans efficiently to retrieve the needed part; prepares by bringing the toolbox with the old part for accurate matching.

Does not follow through on or displays hesitation in dealing with unexpected complications (e.g., noticing unexpected complication with Berta), but there is no clear failure or poor decision shown here.
Tries to lighten the mood by joking about drinking beer around pretty girls instead of armed men.
Encourages Felix to fix the generator despite Felix threatening him with a gun, remains calm and unswayed.
Slips twenty dollars to Berta to keep her from leaving Felix's lap, attempts to manage the social situation.
Stops and complies with guerrillas calmly, showing no aggression or provocation.
Steals through town, hiding and avoiding detection.
Gordy offers to give Felix and Berta some privacy by going for a walk.
Works diligently all night fixing the generator despite tense circumstances.
Tries to lighten the mood by asking Felix if fixing the generator made him happy.
Pushes Felix for payment without aggression but clear expectation.
Fixes the generator successfully under Felix's supervision, showing practical skill and perseverance.
Adapts to tense situations calmly, such as when confronted by guerrillas and Felix, maintaining composure.
Appears deferential and somewhat passive in interactions with Felix, not asserting himself strongly.
Tries to escape by chiseling through the adobe wall and then improvises by using the water pipe and rubber hose to aid his escape.
Tries the locked door, assesses the situation carefully by observing the sentries and environment through windows.
Carries a grenade on his body and deliberately adjusts and secures it, showing awareness and caution.
Searches the room for useful materials and finds sharp metal to chisel through the adobe wall, demonstrating resourcefulness and problem-solving.
Makes slow progress chiseling through the wall, showing persistence despite difficulty.
Realizes that escape through the wall is impossible due to time constraints and incoming threats.
Inventively uses a water pipe and rubber hose to possibly create an escape solution, displaying quick thinking and adaptability under pressure.
Creates a water jet to break through a wall as part of a coordinated plan to aid the guerrillas, shows patience and careful timing.
Smiles upon the timely failure of the diesel generator, indicating satisfaction at the success of his sabotage.
Quickly rigs a high-pressure water hose with wire and pipe to create a tool capable of breaching a wall.
Coordinates his breaching with the timing of a planned generator breakdown diversion, showing foresight and timing.
Successfully creates a hole in the wall using the water jet, enabling access despite limited time.
Smiles confidently after the generator catches fire, indicating calmness under pressure and satisfaction at plan execution.
Rigs a rope under the Suburban to support his back and hangs on tightly to avoid detection.
Endures a dangerous and physically taxing ride under the vehicle, showing resilience and presence of mind.
Snatches a grenade slipping from his grip despite severe pain and danger, carefully re-secures it to avoid harm to others.
Uses distraction (nudging coconut) to avoid detection by guards, demonstrating carefulness and ingenuity without causing harm.
Sneaks carefully to observe the situation and identify individuals inside, showing patience and caution rather than rash behavior.
Uses the coconut to distract the guard so he can avoid detection.
Sneaks carefully from tree to tree and approaches the house stealthily.
Peers into rooms and assesses the situation inside the house quietly.
Recognizes someone (The Wolf) from surveillance and street encounter.
Freezes and eases into shadows when surprised by a guard, avoiding immediate capture.
Freezes and hides when a guard appears, avoiding detection without confrontation.
Attempts to set a grenade to blow up a propane tank, risking his own life in a violent act.
Pauses and shows alarm upon hearing a woman singing gently and seeing a woman and boy approaching, indicating concern for innocent bystanders.
Sees the Woman pull the boy close lovingly and realizes the horror about to happen.
Bursts from his hiding place, yells to warn the Woman and Boy to get back.
Reaches the Woman and Boy and covers them protectively with his body during the explosion.
Does not retaliate immediately when attacked by The Wolf, despite being kicked and booted.
Realizes the impending horror of the bomb explosion and bursts from his hiding place shouting warnings to the Woman and Boy, attempting to save them.
Reaches the Woman and Boy and covers them protectively with his body just before the explosion, ensuring their safety.
Despite being caught in the explosion and subsequently attacked by The Wolf, Gordy manages to get to his hands and knees and sees the Woman and Boy are safe.
Keeps a photo of his wife and son with him, showing emotional attachment and sincerity.
Expresses grief and accuses The Wolf of killing his wife and son despite being severely beaten.
Does not retaliate or respond aggressively after being saved by The Woman's intervention, shows restraint.
Hesitates briefly before engaging The Wolf physically despite being chained and outnumbered.
Fights fiercely and with determination, showing resilience and willingness to confront an adversary aggressively.
Shows no mercy in fighting The Wolf, aiming to inflict serious harm in retaliation.
Takes two brutal blows and drops to his knees, then is beaten unconscious.
Remains conscious long enough to have a brief exchange with Selena before losing consciousness again.
Sits up the next day and questions why Selena feeds him instead of killing him, showing some presence of mind and awareness despite injuries.
Responds calmly and truthfully when questioned about his associations in jail, showing clear self-awareness and honesty.
Does not provide a direct answer when asked if he is anxious to die, showing hesitation or possible emotional vulnerability.
Accepts the photo of his wife and son quietly and reflects on it, showing emotional composure.
Engages in a serious conversation with Selena, expressing concern and distinguishing himself from a man consumed by rage.
Responds bluntly that 'he kills innocent people' and mentions that more killings are planned, showing a direct and candid approach.
Avoids further emotional discussion when Selena becomes uncomfortable and leaves the room without pursuing the topic deeply.
Pause and moment of realization about the escalation of threats (understands the gravity of a new bomb threat in Washington D.C.)
No immediate action shown after learning critical intelligence; remains passive in a tense moment
Expresses concern about children dying and questions the purpose of their deaths.
Accuses Selena of being as much to blame as the antagonist if she does not stop the plan.
Insists that 'We can't let it happen' in response to a threat, attempts to take responsibility and push for prevention
Acknowledges the difficulty of intervention ('We'd never make it') showing awareness of realistic limitations
Expresses frustration but continues to press Selena, attempting to morally motivate action ('If you don't stop it, you're as much to blame as he is')
Ends scene sagging after Selena leaves, indicating emotional and possibly mental overwhelm
Allows Selena to enter his underground bunker and does not resist when she begins unlocking his shackle, showing openness and trust.
Knocks out the guard with the pipe but follows Selena's instruction of 'no needless killing'.
Accepts help from Selena unlocking his shackle and cooperates in their escape plan.
Runs alongside Selena through a dangerous battlefield, showing concern by nearly tripping over the burned body of a child.
Pulls Selena up to keep her afloat despite her wound, encouraging them to survive together.
Carries Mauro out of the river and tries to soothe him with gentle words that mean 'It's okay' in Spanish.
Pauses with a surprised look upon learning Mauro is deaf and mute, showing momentary uncertainty before moving to Selena.
Keeps calm under fire, protects others by getting them to shore safely, attempts to soothe a scared child despite surprise at his condition.
Expresses surprise and hesitation upon learning Mauro can't hear or speak, momentarily pausing before acting.
Carefully treats Selena's bullet wound using part of his shirt as a pressure bandage.
Asks how to say 'hello' in sign language to engage with Mauro.
Smiles warmly as he learns and practices sign language with Mauro, reciprocating the boy's smile.
Holds Mauro gently by the waterfall, allowing the boy to experience touching the sheet of water.
Effectively examines and treats Selena's bullet wound using his shirt as a pressure bandage.
Shows presence of mind in assessing Selena's ability to walk despite injury.
Demonstrates willingness to learn and communicate by attempting to use sign language and engaging with Mauro.
Follows Selena through uncertain terrain including behind a waterfall without hesitation.
Is caught by surprise and ends up surrounded by armed soldiers.
Protects Selena by intervening when Brandt pushes a headset at her, insists she needs a medic and asylum, shows concern for her well-being.
Hates going along with Brandt's custody decision but complies, indicating reluctant acceptance rather than confrontation.
Glares at Brandt when Brandt inspects Selena’s pack and then challenges Brandt's implication ('He wasn't even there').
Carries Mauro, still asleep, showing responsibility and care.
Exchanges look with Selena and hands the boy to an agent after reluctant approval, following protocol correctly.
Asks 'Where're we going?', indicating some lack of situational awareness or preparation momentarily.
Expresses confusion and concern upon learning about the seashell linking Selena to the bombing, showing his emotional response to troubling evidence.
Cooperates with FBI agents by answering questions and pointing out evidence.
Withholds information about cell phone presence when questioned, giving a straightforward 'No' response.
Points out numbered evidence photo (seashell), connecting it to the conversation.
Does not initially understand the contradiction about Selena's fertility, appears confused.
Reacts with distress ('Shit...') upon realizing implication of the seashell evidence.
Blasts through building running, showing urgency and action-oriented response.
Responds honestly to Phipps' question about cell phone, 'No,' indicating accuracy but potentially limited observational input.
Bursts into the room looking for Selena, shows urgency and concern.
Accuses Selena of lying and calling her 'The Wolf' without apparent proof, showing distrust.
Acts quickly to respond to potential danger by running out to follow and presumably help.
Bursts in looking for Selena, immediately suspects her deception, and runs out to pursue her without hesitation.
Runs down stairs four steps at a time, showing physical decisiveness and urgency.
Leaps from a hayloft, launching himself off a parked car to rescue Selena from a speeding Ducati, risking his own safety.
Immediately engages in a physical fight with Claudio after rescuing Selena, showing protective aggression.
Keeps the screaming girl from falling down the stairs after Selena flings her
Chases Selena relentlessly despite dangerous circumstances
Does not stop after being scratched deeply by woman wielding a digging tool, continues pursuit.
Defends himself fiercely against Selena's attack, using a garbage can and physical restraint to subdue her.
Relaxes chokehold to let Selena breathe, resisting urge to kill her despite his fury.
Expresses deep rage and attempts to choke Selena to death.
Despite overwhelming rage, restrains himself from killing Selena, recognizing the importance of maintaining his ethical identity as a firefighter and refusing to cross a lethal moral boundary.
Uses physical dominance to control Selena by a chokehold, demonstrating physical capability and resolve to enforce his will.
Fails to effectively de-escalate the situation with the embassy security guard, who is ready to shoot him due to misunderstanding Gordy's intentions.
Hurls crowbar to try to stop Selena from shooting the guard, showing effort to prevent harm.
Looks at Selena's dead body in disbelief and sorrow before turning and leaving.
Hits Brandt after Brandt callously calls Selena a 'bitch'.
Feeds Junior a spoonful of ice cream and smiles as Junior enjoys it.
Leads the fire company confidently as lieutenant, communicates clearly over headsets during an emergency response.
Moves quickly to coordinate with the battalion chief and ensures the company is hooked up to water despite noisy conditions.
Coaches a youth basketball team, motivates kids loudly, provides immediate tactical instructions in a critical game moment.
Yells at a kid for missing a shot but quickly encourages him to recover defensively, shows situational awareness and leadership under pressure.
Mocks opposing coach during an intense rivalry game (dissing a cop coach).
Struggles to his hands and knees despite pain and injury, attempts to find his family amid chaos.
Oblivious to pain and shoves paramedic away to focus solely on locating Anne and Matt.
Unable to prevent harm to his family, appears helpless as the engine block nearly hits them and spaceship is destroyed.
Recognizes his emotional state but tries to engage and gather information despite grief.
Expresses emotional overwhelm and is restrained from acting impulsively.
Admits he was late and implies regret over the incident.
Rouses from despondency and actively pays attention to the news report about the bombing.
Buries his face in his deceased son's clothes, showing deep grief but no active coping behavior.
Slumps alone in a chair watching TV, displaying passivity and emotional overwhelm without action.
Pins up photos and a large map related to his investigation to organize information visually.
Uses microfilm files and computer access at the New York Public Library to research Colombia and The Wolf.
Pins various Colombia-related articles and a surveillance photo on his wall to gather intelligence.
Draws a perimeter line around the guerrilla zone to define operational areas.
Circles and labels the ELC-controlled area on the map to better understand and mark dangerous zones.
Does not respond to provocation, quietly disengages and leaves the situation.
Asks clear, relevant questions about the journey ahead (e.g., 'How far's Colombia?').
Pays the cab driver promptly and correctly, showing readiness and practical awareness.
Follows Ever's lead without complaint while crossing the dangerous stream.
Does not react aggressively or retaliate after being suddenly attacked and robbed.
Stops a young woman from stepping on a land mine, uses calm and reassuring tone to bring her back to safety, instructs the group to hold hands for stability.
Carefully searches the ground with his machete for mines before stepping forward, successfully identifying and avoiding multiple mines.
Uses a Zippo lighter flame to illuminate the ground to aid in his search, demonstrating resourcefulness.
Applies a tourniquet effectively to the wounded Man in the Yankees Cap, showing medical skill and calm under pressure.
Notices a trip wire in time and shouts a warning to the young man, preventing potential injury.
Avoids eye contact and initially declines the offered seat from Armstrong but eventually sits and engages minimally in conversation.
Reaches out to a small, sleepy boy who shrinks away, then politely invites the boy and his father to share his seat, showing patience and kindness.
Shows situational awareness by reflecting on the cost of the conflict while observing the scenery; suggests traveling with Armstrong to better navigate the area.
Fails to effectively convince Armstrong to travel together or to establish a stronger cover story; does not respond immediately to Armstrong’s pointed remark about the dumb-ass cover story.
Identifies the need to get the guerrilla travel pass inside the cap despite the risk.
Moves quickly toward the girl and capitalizes on her unwittingly placing the cap on the bar.
Successfully grabs the cap and attempts to escape when confronted by federales.
Gets caught by the fat federale and surrounded by both federales despite his efforts.
Gets stunned twice by federales and ends up in jail, indicating failure to avoid capture or anticipate danger.
Maintains silence and calm after arrest, showing emotional control and acceptance of consequences.
Has a clear and direct plan: to find and kill The Wolf responsible for his family’s death.
States a clear plan to go to Caguan, find The Wolf, and kill him.
Maintains composure and attentiveness while imprisoned, listening carefully to murmuring rebels despite Armstrong dozing.
Engages in a brief verbal exchange with Brandt, calmly confronting him about the failure to capture The Wolf.
Does not take direct action after Brandt's taunt, instead allowing others to handle the situation.
Bursts out of the inferno carrying Armstrong to safety despite chaos and danger.
Knocks burning embers off himself and Armstrong, showing care.
Despite Brandt’s silent warning, continues rescuing Armstrong.
Shows concern and engagement by examining Armstrong’s cap to find a pass.
Does not argue or complain when Armstrong explains the absence of the pass and offers it grudgingly.
Shows sincere concern and understanding about coffee beans being guarded, indicating awareness beyond surface level.
Prepares to begin fixing the diesel generators which are critical to operations, implying technical skill and confidence in his abilities.
Dismantles the diesel generators to assess the problem and attempts to fix them despite lack of proper parts.
Quickly calculates that temporary repairs are needed and identifies the need to order parts from Europe while looking for a local machine shop to fabricate a temporary fix.
Expresses frustration by angrily throwing a machine part against the wall.
Uses opportunity during transport to search for The Wolf despite knowing it is a long shot.
Attempts to discreetly hide a grenade from a vigilant guard, demonstrating situational awareness but limited ability to act under surveillance.
Works persistently on the diesel generators despite pressure and distractions, showing dedication and technical effort.
Successfully gets the diesel engine to turn over after initial failure and adjustments, showcasing technical skill and problem-solving.
Fails to meet Felix’s deadline and is reprimanded for lack of progress, indicating possible issues with time management or efficiency.
Thinks fast in conversation to avoid unnecessary conflict and keep the group moving.
Remains calm and unflinching when Felix pulls a gun on him, addressing the issue logically.
Uses money strategically to influence Berta to stay, showing situational awareness and pragmatism.
Prepares a grenade carefully and discreetly, indicating skill and readiness.
Hesitates before attacking The Wolf.
Springs for The Wolf despite the risk, showing willingness to engage.
Demonstrates resilience by springing back after being felled and continuing to fight.
Uses suddenness and fury in a counterattack that catches The Wolf off guard and drives him back.
Attempts to deliver powerful blows aiming to break ribs and crush The Wolf's heart.
Fails to anticipate the bodyguard’s attack and is struck unexpectedly with the butt of an AK.
Thanks Selena for the meal in a simple, sincere manner.
Clarifies he is not aligned with jail inmates and is there for his own reasons, showing honesty and transparency.
Takes photo of his wife and son presented by Selena and looks at it thoughtfully, showing attachment and tenderness.
Recognizes moral differences between himself and Claudio, shows insight about rage and loss, maintains a self-distinct identity.
Asks a direct, pointed question ('Why are you still here?') showing focus and engagement.
States facts about Claudio's actions and plans clearly and confidently ('He kills innocent people.'; 'He's planning to kill more.') indicating awareness of situation.
Throws the soap in the mud after guerrillas mock him, then calmly faces the rain.
Exchanges a meaningful look with Selena, showing a silent connection amid tension.
Allows himself to be roughly dragged out of the bunker and thrown to the ground; does not resist the guerrillas aggressively.
Responds to threat calmly by not escalating the situation; quietly endures humiliation such as having soap offered and throwing it into the mud.
Points his face up into the rain after being humiliated, showing quiet resilience and emotional control.
No visible attempt to effectively escape or counter guerrilla aggression when threatened with a pistol held to his forehead.
Listens attentively to Selena, acknowledges her grim news with concern and calm.
Does not show impatience or dismissiveness when Selena is subdued and haunted.
Brings the pipe down hard on the guard's head, knocking him out and retrieves the guard's AK-47.
Fumbles with the AK-47, looking for the safety switch on the strange weapon.
Watches the burning school and continuing slaughter caused by the rockets and mini-guns without intervening or any indication of active response or decision-making.
Quickly takes cover as Blackhawks land troops and battle erupts; runs toward the trees with Selena during a break in fighting.
Has his AK rifle taken by a bullet during the run, losing his weapon.
Spots fuel cans near the river and uses them as flotation devices to help swim across with Mauro and Selena.
Carries Mauro into the river, effectively managing the physical challenge while ensuring the child's safety.
Maintains composure and calls out to Selena after she is hit, showing situational awareness and care under pressure.
Upon hearing the helicopter, immediately instructs Mauro to dive underwater with him and Selena to avoid detection.
Maintains situational awareness during the escape by noticing the helicopter approaching and reacting quickly.
No indication of hesitation or confusion when under pressure in dangerous environment.
Intervenes to protect Selena by grabbing Brandt's arm and advocates for Selena's asylum and medical needs.
Shows restraint and pragmatism by going along with Brandt's decisions despite personal dislike.
Challenges Brandt's assumption about Selena's involvement by stating 'He wasn't even there' confidently.
Carries sleeping child Mauro carefully, showing protective and steady behavior amidst a tense situation.
Participates in coordinated government operation with FBI agents, implying trusted role in critical mission.
Just barely evades a shovel blade thrown with perfect timing, showing alertness and quick reflexes.
Keeps up with Selena who is faster and chases her through various obstacles, demonstrating persistence and physical capability.
Arrives just in time to catch a girl flung down the stairs by Selena, preventing serious injury.
Keeps pursuing Selena despite being attacked and scratched deeply in the face.
Does not stop or show hesitation after being attacked; immediately follows Selena onto the roof and pursues her over rooftops with apparent skill and endurance.
Grabs Selena on the balcony, attempts to stop her despite risk of injury.
Retreats when attacked by Selena, uses available objects defensively rather than counterattacking aggressively.
Uses a garbage can to block crowbar blows despite the difficulty and pain.
Recognizes and reacts to Selena's feints effectively, though takes some hits.
Recovers from stumbling and uses strength and strategy to take Selena down by slinging the can and tackling her.
Applies a police chokehold and maintains control despite resistance, demonstrating physical skill and determination.
Hits Claudio with jackhammer blows in the bunker, physically overpowering Brandt.
Cold and hard voice showing emotional control while confronting Brandt.
Successfully repairs the ice cream maker and makes ice cream enjoyed by Mauro and colleagues.
Expresses emotional vulnerability but also resilience and readiness to return to duty and community.
No visible indications of confusion, failure, or inability to perform in the excerpt.
